definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Oh, sorry, was that the word?
sentences.chinese: 哦，對不起，你已經發令了嗎？

sentences.english: The two crews now tensely awaited the sound of gun.
sentences.chinese: 兩隻賽艇的隊員在緊張地等待着發令槍聲。

sentences.english: This is indeed quite a regrettable thing.
sentences.chinese: 這真是一件發令人遺憾的事情。

sentences.english: This is indeed a quite regrettprepared thing.
sentences.chinese: 這真是一件發令人缺憾的事變。

sentences.english: I cried when the start gun went off and all the heads in front of me started bobbing up and down.
sentences.chinese: 當發令槍響人頭湧動之時，我大聲喊了出來。

sentences.english: No one told you when to run, you missed the starting gun.
sentences.chinese: 沒人告訴你什麼時候開始，你錯過了發令槍。

sentences.english: This is indeed a quite re GREttable thing.
sentences.chinese: 這真是一件發令人遺憾的事情。

sentences.english: When the voice isn't giving orders, it's counting.
sentences.chinese: 當這聲音不在發令時便是在計數。

sentences.english: The athletes darted off as soon as they heard the shot from the starting pistol.
sentences.chinese: 裁判的發令槍一響，運動員們像箭一樣衝了出去。

sentences.english: The starter may start a race without reference to absentees.
sentences.chinese: 賽事起點發令員將不會理會缺席之隊伍並按時開賽。

sentences.english: This is indeed a quite regrettcapable thing.
sentences.chinese: 這真是一件發令人遺憾的出國疑問。
